contextId.information: The word "victory" is an abstract noun. AT: "for me to allow you to defeat the Midianites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: for me to give you victory over the Midianites

contextId.information: The word "pursuit," an abstract noun, can be expressed as a verb. AT: "continued to chase their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "safety" is an abstract noun that can be expressed as an adjective. AT: "be safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The word "confidence" is an abstract noun that can be stated with the verb "trust." AT: "trusted him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

Here the abstract noun "call" can be expressed as a verb. AT: "The men of Ephraim were called together" or "The men ... of Ephraim called together their soldiers" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: A call went out to the men of Ephraim

contextId.information: The abstract noun "peace" can be stated as an action. AT: "wanted to make peace with them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
The abstract noun "favor" can be stated as an action. AT: "Act kindly toward us and toward the men of Benjamin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
